description: September 14, 2020: With Bulletin N. 262, the Italian Ministry of Health announced that the Italian Minister of Health, Roberto Speranza, has attended the 70th session of the WHO Regional Committee for Europe (RC70), organised by the WHO Regional Office for Europe, on September 14 and 15, 2020. Representatives of 53 countries in the WHO European Region have attended. Representatives of WHO partners such as United Nations agencies and other intergovernmental organisations and regional networks, were also present. Non-State actors (NSAs) in official relations with WHO and regional NSAs accredited by the Regional Committee, have followed the webstream and had the opportunity to submit video and written statements in advance. The key health issues and future plans have been discussed, particularly on themes regarding the response to the COVID-19 pandemic and lessons learned from the pandemic, both globally and regionally.

Individuals under age 18 are permitted to be outside their homes or places of temporary residence each day between the hours of 1:00 p.m. and 7:00 p.m. only. *People in need of emergency medical assistance are exempted from the curfew, as are some essential workers such as police, armed forces, health workers, and farmers directly engaged in agricultural work.

description: Starting from May 22nd, 2020, all person entering the territory of North Macedonia should present a negative PCR test for COVID 19 taken within 72 hours from the arrival. This will allow the person entering North Macedonia to be sent to mandatory self-isolation for 14 days  or 21 if coming from a high-risk country. The person who will not present a PCR test will be sent to a mandatory state quarantine facility where in due time a PCR test for COVID-19 will be done and depending on the results, those persons will later be sent to mandatory self-isolation.All persons who are conducted in the facilities for state quarantine, at their own expense, can do a PCR test in the facility where they are accommodated and if they have a negative result to be referred to home self-isolation. A protocol was adopted for foreign diplomats accredited in the country and members of their families, who if they submit a medical certificate for negative PCR test made in the last 72 hours. Entering the Republic of Northern Macedonia, they will be able to perform their work smoothly and currently, without referring to domestic self-isolation.  An exception from the mandatory self-isolation rule will be possible for foreigners who will present a negative PCR test for COVID-19 as stated above, only if there is valid state or economical interest in which case, the Government's Body will decide on individual basis and the person will have to follow protocols of the Ministry of Health.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries

description: North Macedonia declared on March 1st 2020 that persons with COVID-19 symptoms should remain at home until they recover after clinical examinations and laboratory findings show two negative RT-PCR tests performed at least 24 hours apart. The same principle of care applies to symptomatic patients who no longer need hospitalisation.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: North Macedonia  began mandating a 14 day self-isolation for all passengers arriving from high to mid risky states.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 10, 2020, the Government of North Macedonia declared that a new policy is in power which states that all domestic and foreign natural persons, travelers from the countries of the African continent who enter the border crossings on the territory of the Republic of Northern Macedonia, will be referred to 14-day domestic isolation (quarantine). For all types of group or individual travel, travelers from countries on the African continent transiting through the territory of the Republic of Northern Macedonia, it will be mandatory to sign a Transit Statement.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_country: Algeria,Angola,Botswana,Burundi,Cameroon,Cabo Verde,Central African Republic,Chad,Comoros,Republic of Congo,Democratic Republic of the Congo,Benin,Equatorial Guinea,Ethiopia,Eritrea,Djibouti,Gabon,Gambia,Ghana,Guinea,Ivory Coast,Kenya,Lesotho,Liberia,Libya,Madagascar,Malawi,Mali,Mauritania,Mauritius,Morocco,Mozambique,Namibia,Niger,Nigeria,Guinea-Bissau,Réunion,Rwanda,Sao Tome and Principe,Senegal,Seychelles,Sierra Leone,Somalia,South Africa,Zimbabwe,South Sudan,Sudan,Swaziland,Togo,Tunisia,Uganda,Republic of Tanzania,Burkina Faso,Zambia
target_geog_level: One or more regional groupings

date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: On March 20th 2020, the Government of North Macedonia decided that all citizens of North Macedonia returning from flights after serving for humanitarian purposes are obliged to start a 15-day quarantine with food and other services, excluding travel costs, paid by the budget of North Macedonia, starting March 23nd, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 4, 2020, the government of North Macedonia delcared that if citizens of North Macedonia have to travel to one of the countries on the list of countries listed as high or medium risk, it is recommended that they postpone the trip, unless it is a trip related to medical purposes. If they are traveling from one of these countries, they must report to the border police that you are traveling from such a country and start a 14-day period of home self-isolation.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 23rd, 2020, the government of North Macedonia announced that with immediate effect, all citizens who are awaiting a COVID-19 test result are obliged to self-quarantine, independent if they show symptoms or not, until they receive a negative test result.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On June 17, 2020, the Republic of Northern Macedonia announced the 14-day state quarantine measure also applies to all citizens or foreigners with a regulated stay in the country who, upon entering the territory of the Republic of Northern Macedonia, will not submit a valid PCR test or will submit an invalid PCR test.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: North Macedonia will allow up to a maximum of six persons, up from the previous maximum of four, to sit at the same table inside the hotel spaces, all while maintaining a safety distance, starting June 1, 2021.

description: North Macedonia will allow weddings and other festivities to take place in open air, with terraces limited to 50% capacity, up to a maximum of 100 people. All participants should follow the hygiene rules and keep the necessary distance. The policy comes into effect at June 1, 2021.
